br.edu.ifsp.pds.shadowstruggles.model

Class BattleMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.edu.ifsp.pds.shadowstruggles.model.BattleMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.Serializable

    public class BattleMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.Serializable
    A BattleMap object is a three-dimensional Array containing the cards placed on the field. A card is inside an Array of cards, which is inside a tile, which is inside an Array of tiles. Thus, it is possible to have multiple cards on each tile.

      • cardOnMap

        public boolean cardOnMap(Card c,
                int lane,
                int player)
        Verifies if the card is on the map. Lane is an optional attribute which informs whether a specific lane should be searched or all of them. All of the lanes are searched if lane = -1.

      • enemyBaseAttacked

        public int enemyBaseAttacked()
        Verifies if the enemy base is being attacked. The base is being attacked if it's inside the range of an enemy fighter.

      • playerBaseAttacked

        public int playerBaseAttacked()
        Verifies if the player base is being attacked. The base is being attacked if it's inside the range of an enemy fighter.

      • getPlayerCards

        public com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<Card> getPlayerCards()
        Returns an Array of Card containing all of the cards belonging to the human player on the field.

      • getEnemyCards

        public com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<Card> getEnemyCards()
        Returns an Array of Card containing all of the cards belonging to the machine player on the field.

      • nextAvailableLane

        public int nextAvailableLane(int player)
        Returns the next available lane, from top to down. A lane is available if there is at least one free slot in it.
        Parameters:
        player - Indicates which field to look into: BattleMap.HUMAN_PLAYER or BattleMap.ENEMY_PLAYER.

      • nextAvailableTile

        public int nextAvailableTile(int lane,
                    int player)
        Returns the next available tile in the specified lane, from the outside to into the base. A tile is available if it's not occupied by a card.
        Parameters:
        lane -
        player - Indicates which field to look into: BattleMap.HUMAN_PLAYER or BattleMap.ENEMY_PLAYER.

      • laneWithMoreEnemies

        public int laneWithMoreEnemies(int player)
        Returns the lane with the greatest number of enemy fighters.
        Parameters:
        player - Indicates which field to look into: BattleMap.HUMAN_PLAYER or BattleMap.ENEMY_PLAYER.

      • laneWithLessAllies

        public int laneWithLessAllies(int player)
        Returns the lane with the least number of allied fighters.
        Parameters:
        player - Indicates which field to look into: BattleMap.HUMAN_PLAYER or BattleMap.ENEMY_PLAYER.

      • laneWithMoreEnemiesInvading

        public int laneWithMoreEnemiesInvading(int player)
        Returns the lane with the greatest number of enemy fighters invading the player's field.
        Parameters:
        player - Indicates which field to look into: BattleMap.HUMAN_PLAYER or BattleMap.ENEMY_PLAYER.

      • tileClosestToBase

        public int tileClosestToBase(int lane,
                    int player)
        Returns the next available tile in the specified lane that is closest to the base. A tile is available if it's not occupied by a card.
        Parameters:
        lane -
        player - Indicates which field to look into: BattleMap.HUMAN_PLAYER or BattleMap.ENEMY_PLAYER.

      • tileFurthestFromBase

        public int tileFurthestFromBase(int lane,
                       int player)
        Returns the next available tile in the specified lane that is furthest from the base. A tile is available if it's not occupied by a card.
        Parameters:
        lane -
        player - Indicates which field to look into: BattleMap.HUMAN_PLAYER or BattleMap.ENEMY_PLAYER.
